column4: is it normal that the fglrx driver in the package manager does not work?
I followed every guide I found on the net but I can't get it to work :((
did you follow the Ubuntu wiki's ATI page?
including the part about changing the configs with X shut down? I had to do that to get my ATI 9600XT's 3d running in Breezy, but now it works flawlessly.
yes I have the fglrx driver in my xorg.conf and as you can see it also tries to load up
you've done the whole reconfiguration with X shut down?
yes I've done that, stopped gdm and all
I'm using 386 maybe they only ship working packages with k7
no idea about kernel vs graphics... sorry. You might want to check out the Ubuntu forums, though
how would I go about switching the kernel? I'm a bit new in that biz
what actual chip are you running?
you can run the k7 kernel, then -
I had a Linux-savvy friend switch this machine over to the k7 kernel, so I can't remember how we did it... sorry
wow, it works in the k7 version. shitty ubuntu :/
